original: Brändstedt, Carl Gustav (Gösta), lasarettsläkare, regementsläkare, Uddevalla, f. 5/11/99 i Sthlm av fabr. C. W. Svensson o. Emma Brändstedt. G. 34 m. tandläk. Hed Paulsson. Barn: Stephan f. 43, Eva 45. — Stud:ex. 17, med. kand. 21 o. med. lic. 26 i Sthlm, med. dr i Lund 35. Div. förordn. s. assist:- o. und :läk. 24-26, und :läk. v. Gällivare las. 27-2S, v. Linköp. las. kir. avd. 28-29, e. läk., aman. samt tf. und:läk. v. ögonklin. i Lund 29-30, 31-32 o. 33-34, e. läk. f. ögonsjukv. v. Uddevalla las. 35-38, las:läk. där sed. 38. Bat:läk. i Fik res. 26, v. Fik 31, bat:-läk. v. Bohusl. reg. 33, reg:läk. där sed. 38. Stud. v. ögonklin. i Köpenhamn fem mån. 33. Ordf. i Bohusl. läk:fören., fullm. i läk:förb. Skr.: Studien über minimum perceptibile und distinktionsvermögen besonders bei myopi (35). • RVO.
translated: Brändstedt, Carl Gustav (Gösta), a doctor at a hospital and regimental doctor in Uddevalla, was born on November 5th, 1899 in Stockholm to C.W. Svensson, a factory worker, and Emma Brändstedt. He married Hed Paulsson, a dentist, in 1934, and they had two children: Stephan, born in 1943, and Eva, born in 1945. Brändstedt graduated from high school in 1917, earned his Bachelor of Medicine degree in 1921 and his medical license in 1926 in Stockholm. He received his doctorate in medicine in Lund in 1935. He held various positions as assistant and deputy doctor from 1924 to 1934, including deputy doctor in Gällivare Hospital from 1927 to 1928, and surgical department of Linköping Hospital from 1928 to 1929. He was a medical assistant, assistant and temporary deputy doctor at the ophthalmology clinic in Lund from 1929 to 1930, 1931 to 1932 and 1933 to 1934. He was appointed medical doctor for eye care at Uddevalla hospital from 1935 to 1938, and became a hospital doctor there in 1938. He served as a battalion doctor in Fik in 1926 and 1931 and later as a battalion doctor for the Bohuslän regiment in 1933, finally becoming their regimental doctor in 1938. He studied at the ophthalmology clinic in Copenhagen for five months in 1933. He was the chairman of the Bohuslän Medical Association and a delegate to the Swedish Medical Association. He authored the publication entitled "Studies on minimum perceptibility and distinctiveness, particularly in myopia" in 1935 and was awarded the Illis Quorum medal.

author.name: Studies on minimum perceptibility and distinctiveness, particularly in myopia
